SEARCH
Module Simulador
Package simulador

Class SimulacionUtils

java.lang.Object
simulador.SimulacionUtils
public class SimulacionUtils extends Object
The SimulacionUtils class provides utility methods for performing simulations, generating timestamps, writing simulation results to files, and ensuring that the necessary output directory exists.

  • Constructor Details

    • SimulacionUtils

      public SimulacionUtils()

  • Method Details

    • generateTimestamp

      public static String generateTimestamp(long time)
      Generates a timestamp string based on the provided time in milliseconds. The timestamp is formatted as yyyyMMdd_HHmmss_SSS.
      Parameters:
      time - The time in milliseconds to generate the timestamp from.
      Returns:
      A string representing the formatted timestamp.

    • simulation

      public static double simulation(int type)
      Runs a simulation for a specified protein type. The simulation performs a calculation based on the type and runs for a dynamically calculated amount of time.
      Parameters:
      type - The type of simulation to run, corresponding to different protein types.
      Returns:
      The result of the simulation (a double value).

    • writeSimulationResults

      public static void writeSimulationResults(String fileName, long start, long end, double result) throws IOException
      Writes the results of a simulation to a file. The results include the start and end timestamps, the simulation duration, and the simulation result.
      Parameters:
      fileName - The name of the file to write the results to.
      start - The start time of the simulation in milliseconds.
      end - The end time of the simulation in milliseconds.
      result - The result of the simulation (a double value).
      Throws:
      IOException - If an I/O error occurs while writing to the file.

    • ensureOutputDirectoryExists

      public static void ensureOutputDirectoryExists()
      Ensures that the output directory exists. If the directory does not exist, it is created along with any necessary subdirectories.
